title: Set Up Google Search Console for Your Website
excerpt: Learn how to set up Google Search Console to analyze and optimize your website's visibility on search engines.
content:
Google Search Console is an essential tool for monitoring and improving your website's performance in Google search results. Here is a step-by-step guide to configure Search Console.

1. Access Google Search Console

To get started:

  1. Visit the official Google Search Console website.
  2. Log in with your Google account or sign up if you havenâ€™t done so already.

2. Add Your Domain or URL

Once logged in:

  1. Click on the option to add a property.
  • Choose one of the following verification methods:
    • Option 1 - Domain Verification:
      • Enter your domain name in the designated field.
      • Click on Continue. A dialog box with instructions will appear.
      • Add the provided code to your domain's DNS settings.
      • Wait a few minutes for the changes to take effect.
    • Option 2 - URL Prefix:
      • Enter the full URL of your website in the provided field.
      • Click on Continue. Another dialog box will appear with an HTML code.
      • Copy the provided meta tag.
      • Paste this tag into the main HTML file of your project, inside the <head> tag.

    3. Deploy and Validate

    1. If you modified the HTML file, redeploy your project on your hosting platform.
    2. Return to Google Search Console and click on Validate.
    3. Wait until the validation is confirmed.

    4. Conclusion

    Once configured, Google Search Console allows you to track your website's performance, identify issues, and optimize its visibility in search engines. Make sure to regularly check the reports to improve your SEO.
